CatDescriptText: Mrs. Esther Young, housewife and mother, of 2129 Bentley Dr., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: "No, I don't think so. I do not think that they want anything to happen here similar to the Chicago fire disaster.  The taxpayers, I believe, want their children to be safe, and therefore they would not oppose an increase in taxes to have better schools."
TitMainTitle: Esther Young, wearing dark coat with collar, cuffs, and lapels, holding light colored gloves and paper bag, standing on sidewalk in front of Buick car, young boy on left wearing plaid zippered jacket with collar
